definitions: move troops or equipment into position for military action or strategic advantage
bring into effective action or utilize available resources for a particular purpose
examples: The army will deploy additional forces to the border region
They deployed troops across the entire coastal defense line
The company deployed its best engineers to solve the critical problem
She deployed her skills effectively to negotiate the complex deal

definitions: forcibly remove a foreign national from a country typically for legal or political reasons
behave or conduct oneself in a specified manner especially with dignity
examples: The government threatened to deport all illegal immigrants within thirty days
They deported him back to his country of origin yesterday
She deported herself with grace and dignity throughout the ceremony
The young diplomat deported himself admirably during the tense negotiations

definitions: remove someone from office or position of authority suddenly and forcefully
give evidence or testimony under oath typically in a legal proceeding
examples: The military coup attempted to depose the democratically elected president
The board of directors voted to depose the corrupt CEO
The witness will depose before the grand jury next week
She was required to depose about her knowledge of the incident

definitions: put or set down something in a specific place carefully or formally
place money into a bank account or financial institution for safekeeping
gradually accumulate as a layer or covering through natural processes
examples: She deposited the heavy boxes carefully on the warehouse floor
The courier deposited the package at the front desk
He deposits his paycheck into his savings account every month
They deposited ten thousand dollars as a down payment
The river deposits silt along its banks during the flood season
Minerals slowly deposit on the cave walls over thousands of years

definitions: push or press something down with physical force or weight
make someone feel extremely sad discouraged or without hope
reduce the level value or activity of something in a market or system
examples: Depress the brake pedal slowly to come to a smooth stop
She depressed the button to activate the emergency alarm system
The constant bad news really depresses me about the future
The gloomy weather tends to depress people during winter months
High unemployment rates will depress consumer spending throughout the economy
Rising interest rates typically depress housing prices in most markets

definitions: take something away from someone preventing them from having or using it
prevent someone from having or experiencing something considered necessary or desirable
examples: The court ruling deprived him of his parental rights permanently
They cannot deprive citizens of their constitutional freedoms without cause
The illness deprived her of the ability to walk independently
Poverty deprives millions of children of proper education and healthcare

definitions: appoint someone to act as a deputy or representative with specific authority
transfer power responsibility or authority to another person temporarily
examples: The manager will depute her assistant to handle client meetings
They deputed him to negotiate on behalf of the union
The president deputed certain powers to the vice president
She deputed the task of organizing the conference to her team

definitions: cause a train or tram to leave its tracks accidentally or deliberately
prevent a plan process or discussion from continuing successfully or as intended
examples: The freight train derailed after hitting debris on the tracks
Saboteurs attempted to derail the passenger train near the bridge
Personal conflicts threatened to derail the important peace negotiations
Budget cuts could derail the entire research project next year

definitions: obtain something from a specified source through extraction reasoning or calculation
have something as an origin source or basis historically or logically
examples: Scientists derive this medicine from a rare tropical plant
We can derive important conclusions from analyzing these data patterns
The word derives from an ancient Latin term for warrior
Her confidence derives from years of successful professional experience

definitions: move or fall downward through space or along a surface
be related to someone by birth through a line of ancestors
arrive somewhere suddenly especially in large numbers or with force
examples: The hikers carefully descended the steep mountain trail before sunset
The plane began to descend toward the airport runway
She descends from a long line of accomplished musicians
The royal family descends directly from the medieval kings
Reporters descended on the scene within minutes of the announcement
A plague of locusts descended upon the agricultural region

definitions: give a spoken or written detailed account of something including characteristics or features
mark out or draw a shape or geometrical figure with a movement
examples: Can you describe what the suspect looked like to the police?
The witness described the accident in vivid detail yesterday
The compass point describes a perfect circle on the paper
Her hand described an arc through the air

definitions: end the policy or practice of racial segregation in schools institutions or facilities
examples: The Supreme Court ordered schools to desegregate immediately following the ruling
The city finally desegregated its public transportation system in 1965

definitions: abandon a person place or organization permanently leaving them without help or support
illegally leave military service without permission or intention to return
examples: He deserted his family when the children were very young
The residents deserted the town after the factory closed down
Three soldiers deserted their unit during the night patrol
He was court-martialed for deserting his post during combat

definitions: be worthy of or have a rightful claim to reward punishment or treatment
examples: She deserves recognition for all her hard work this year
He certainly didn't deserve such harsh criticism from the committee

definitions: create detailed plans drawings or specifications for something to be constructed or manufactured
plan or intend something for a specific purpose function or end result
examples: She designs innovative websites for international technology companies
The architect designed a stunning modern museum for the city
This program was designed to help students improve their writing
The new law is designed to protect consumer privacy rights

definitions: officially assign a particular status role or name to someone or something
identify indicate or specify something for a particular purpose or role
examples: The committee will designate a new chairman at tomorrow's meeting
They designated the area as a protected wildlife sanctuary
Please designate which items should be shipped express delivery
The map designates camping areas with small tent symbols

definitions: strongly wish for or want something to happen or to possess something
feel sexual attraction or romantic longing for another person
examples: She desires nothing more than peace and quiet after work
The company desires to expand into international markets next year
He had secretly desired her for years without saying anything
She found herself desiring someone she could never have

definitions: stop doing something especially something harmful wrong or legally prohibited
examples: The judge ordered them to desist from making false claims
Please desist from smoking in this non-smoking area immediately

definitions: make someone feel utterly wretched unhappy lonely or abandoned emotionally
destroy or ruin a place making it empty bleak and uninhabitable
examples: The tragic news completely desolated the entire family
Years of loneliness had desolated her once cheerful spirit
War desolated the once thriving countryside for many generations
The hurricane desolated entire coastal communities within hours

definitions: lose or be without hope especially about the future or a situation
examples: Don't despair because there are still options available to us
She began to despair of ever finding her lost cat

definitions: send someone or something to a destination quickly for a purpose
kill a person or animal quickly and efficiently
examples: They will despatch the documents by courier this afternoon
The company despatched technicians to repair the critical equipment
The hunter despatched the wounded deer with a single shot
The assassin was hired to despatch the target quietly

definitions: feel intense dislike contempt or disgust for someone or something
examples: She absolutely despises people who are cruel to animals
He despised himself for being too cowardly to speak up

definitions: cause something to become unstable uncertain or unlikely to continue normally
examples: Political unrest threatens to destabilise the entire region
These economic policies could destabilise international currency markets

definitions: cause something to become unstable uncertain or unlikely to continue normally
examples: Foreign interference attempted to destabilize the democratic government
Rising inflation could destabilize the recovering economy

definitions: damage something so badly that it cannot be repaired or no longer exists
completely ruin someone emotionally financially or professionally
examples: The fire destroyed three buildings in the downtown area
The tsunami destroyed entire coastal villages within minutes
The scandal completely destroyed his political career forever
Years of addiction had destroyed her family relationships

definitions: destroy something deliberately especially through an automatic built-in mechanism
examples: The missile will destruct automatically if it goes off course
The device is programmed to destruct after completing its mission

definitions: separate disconnect or remove something from something else it was attached to
become emotionally distant or uninvolved with a situation or person
examples: Please detach the power cable before moving the computer
You can detach the hood from this winter jacket
She learned to detach herself emotionally from difficult patients
He gradually detached from his old group of friends

definitions: describe or provide comprehensive information about something including all particulars
assign someone officially to undertake a particular task or duty
examples: The report details every aspect of the proposed construction project
She detailed her travel expenses in the quarterly financial statement
The captain detailed two soldiers to guard the entrance
They detailed him to investigate the security breach

definitions: keep someone in official custody typically for questioning or investigation
prevent someone from proceeding by holding them back or delaying them
examples: Police can detain suspects for up to 48 hours without charges
Immigration officials detained him at the border for questioning
I won't detain you any longer with these minor details
Bad weather detained us at the airport for several hours

definitions: discover or identify the presence or existence of something hidden or subtle
notice or become aware of something through observation or senses
examples: The security system can detect any unauthorized movement instantly
Scientists detected traces of water on the distant planet
I could detect a hint of sarcasm in her voice
Dogs can detect certain diseases through their sense of smell

definitions: discourage or prevent someone from doing something through fear doubt or difficulty
examples: High prices deter many people from buying organic food products
The threat of punishment failed to deter the criminals

definitions: become progressively worse in quality condition or value over time
examples: His health began to deteriorate rapidly after the diagnosis
The building's foundation has deteriorated significantly over the decades

definitions: discover establish or ascertain exactly through research examination or calculation
be the decisive factor in causing something to happen in a particular way
firmly decide to do something with resolution and commitment
examples: Scientists determined the age of the fossil through carbon dating
The investigation will determine who was responsible for the accident
Your performance will determine whether you receive a promotion
Weather conditions often determine the success of the harvest
She determined to finish her degree despite the many obstacles
He determined that he would never make that mistake again

definitions: remove a monarch from their throne or someone from a position of authority
examples: The revolution sought to dethrone the corrupt king
They finally dethroned the champion after ten years of dominance

definitions: explode or cause a bomb or explosive device to explode violently
examples: The bomb failed to detonate due to faulty wiring
Experts carefully detonated the old munitions in a controlled explosion

definitions: take a longer alternative route to avoid something or reach a destination
examples: We had to detour through the countryside due to road construction
The hikers detoured around the flooded section of the trail

definitions: undergo treatment to remove toxic or addictive substances from the body
examples: He decided to detox from alcohol at a rehabilitation center
Many people detox with special diets after the holiday season

definitions: reduce or take away the worth value or importance of something
examples: These minor flaws don't detract from the overall quality
His rude behavior detracts from his professional accomplishments

definitions: reduce or underestimate the worth importance or value of something or someone
examples: The government decided to devalue the national currency by ten percent
Don't devalue your own contributions to this important project

definitions: destroy or ruin something completely leaving it in ruins or useless
cause someone severe emotional shock distress or grief
examples: The earthquake devastated the entire coastal region last year
Years of drought devastated the agricultural economy
The unexpected death of her son completely devastated her
He was devastated when his business failed after twenty years

definitions: grow or cause to grow and become more advanced mature or elaborate
create or produce something new through systematic work planning or evolution
begin to exist experience or possess something gradually over time
examples: Children develop language skills rapidly during their first five years
The company developed from a small startup into a global corporation
They developed a new vaccine in record time
She developed an innovative app for managing personal finances
He developed a severe allergy to peanuts in his thirties
Storm clouds are developing quickly over the mountain range

definitions: depart from an established course path standard or normal behavior
examples: The plane had to deviate from its flight path due to storms
Don't deviate from the instructions I gave you earlier

definitions: harass annoy or bother someone persistently in a playful or malicious way
examples: Stop deviling your younger sister with those silly pranks
The reporters continued to devil him about his past mistakes

definitions: plan invent or create something complex or clever through careful thought
examples: Engineers devised an ingenious solution to the water shortage problem
She devised a brilliant strategy to win the competition

definitions: transfer or delegate power authority or responsibility to a lower level
gradually deteriorate degenerate or descend into a worse state
examples: The government will devolve certain powers to regional authorities
The CEO devolved daily operations to her management team
The debate quickly devolved into personal attacks and shouting
The peaceful protest devolved into violent confrontation with police

definitions: give all or most of one's time energy or resources to something
examples: She devoted her entire life to helping homeless children
He devotes three hours every day to practicing the piano

definitions: eat food or prey hungrily quickly or in large quantities
read watch or consume something eagerly and quickly with great interest
examples: The hungry children devoured everything on their plates within minutes
Lions devoured the gazelle carcass in the African savanna
She devoured the entire novel in one sitting last night
He devours every article about space exploration he can find

definitions: identify the nature of an illness or medical condition through examination
identify the nature or cause of a problem or situation through analysis
examples: The doctor diagnosed her with Type 2 diabetes last month
It took specialists months to correctly diagnose his rare condition
The mechanic quickly diagnosed the problem with the car's engine
Engineers diagnosed a critical flaw in the software system

definitions: represent or illustrate something by drawing a diagram chart or graphic representation
examples: The teacher diagrammed the sentence structure on the whiteboard
Can you diagram the new organizational structure for the presentation?

definitions: make a telephone call by entering or selecting a phone number
adjust or select a setting on a device by turning a dial
examples: She dialed her mother's number but got no answer
In emergencies, dial 911 for immediate assistance
Dial the temperature down to prevent the food from burning
He carefully dialed in the radio frequency
